<!-- If You Update This Article Please Remember to Update Other Ubuntu Derivatives Which Include, But Are Not Limited To: Ubuntu, Kubuntu, Edubuntu, Xubuntu, Gobuntu --> {{Infobox OS | name = Kubuntu | logo = [[File:Kubuntu-logo-lucid.svg|200px|Kubuntu logo]] | screenshot = [[File:UbuntuNattyKDE.png|300px]] | caption = Kubuntu 11.04 "Natty Narwhal" | developer = [[Canonical Ltd.]] and [https://launchpad.net/people/kubuntu-members community contributors] | family = [[Unix-like]] (variant of [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]]) | source_model = [[Free and open source software]] | released = 8 April 2005 | latest_release_version = 11.10 (Oneiric Ocelot)<ref>[http://www.kubuntu.org/news/11.10-release Kubuntu 11.10 announcement]</ref> | latest_release_date = {{release date|2011|10|13}} | latest_test_version = | latest_test_date = | marketing_target = | language = Multilingual (more than 55) | kernel_type = [[Monolithic kernel|Monolithic]] [[Linux kernel]] | userland = [[GNU Core Utilities|GNU]] | ui = [[KDE Plasma Desktop]] | license = Various, primarily the [[GNU GPL]] and [[GFDL]] | working_state = Current | supported_platforms = [[IA-32]], [[x86-64]], [[LPIA|lpia]], [[SPARC]], [[PowerPC]], [[ARM architecture|ARM]], [[IA-64]] | updatemodel = [[PackageKit]] and/or [[Advanced Packaging Tool|APT]] | package_manager = [[dpkg]] (Debian GNU/Linux Package Manager) | website = [http://www.kubuntu.org www.kubuntu.org] }}
'''Kubuntu''' ({{IPAc-en|icon|k|uË|Ë|b|uË|n|t|uË}} {{respell|koo|BOON|too}}) is an official derivative of the [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]] [[operating system]] using the [[KDE Plasma Desktop]] instead of the [[Unity (desktop environment)|Unity]] graphical environment. It is part of the Ubuntu project and uses the same underlying system. It is possible to install both the KDE Plasma Desktop (kubuntu-desktop) as well as the Unity desktop (ubuntu-desktop) on the same machine. Every package in Kubuntu shares the same repositories as Ubuntu.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kubuntu.org/faq.php#fork |title=Is Kubuntu a fork? |archiveurl = http://web.archive.org/web/20080307181806/http://www.kubuntu.org/faq.php#fork |archivedate = 2008-03-07}}</ref> It is released regularly on the same schedule as Ubuntu.<ref>[https://wiki.kubuntu.org/Kubuntu Kubuntu Wiki]</ref>
== Name == "Kubuntu" means "towards humanity" in [[Bemba language|Bemba]], and is derived from ''[[Ubuntu (philosophy)|ubuntu]]'' ("humanity"). The K at the beginning represents the [[KDE]] community on whose platform Kubuntu is built. By coincidence, Kubuntu also means "free" in [[Kirundi]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kubuntu.org/faq.php#kubuntumeaning |title=Meaning of Kubuntu |archiveurl = http://web.archive.org/web/20080307181806/http://www.kubuntu.org/faq.php#kubuntumeaning |archivedate = 2008-03-07}}</ref>
== Comparison with Ubuntu == The difference between these two sister operating systems is typically only graphical applications and tools used.
{| class="wikitable" style="width:24%;font-size:85%;float:right; margin-right:1.5em" |- ! Color ! Meaning |- | style="background-color:#A0E75A;" | Green | Both OSs |- | style="background-color:#fab372;" | Orange | Ubuntu Default |- | style="background-color:#87CEEB;" | Blue | Kubuntu Default |}
{| class="wikitable" |- ! Software ! Ubuntu ! Kubuntu |- | Kernel & Core | style="background-color:#A0E75A;" colspan="2"| Linux Kernel & Ubuntu Core |- | Graphics | style="background-color:#A0E75A;" colspan="2"| X.Org Server |- | Sound | style="background-color:#A0E75A;" colspan="2"| PulseAudio |- | Multimedia | style="background-color:#A0E75A;" colspan="2"| GStreamer |- | Desktop | style="background-color:#fab372;" | Unity | style="background-color:#87CEEB;" | Plasma Desktop |- | Primary Toolkit | style="background-color:#fab372;" | GTK+, Nux & Qt | style="background-color:#87CEEB;" | Qt |- | Browser | style="background-color:#fab372;" | Firefox | style="background-color:#87CEEB;" | Rekonq |- | Office | style="background-color:#A0E75A;" colspan="2" | LibreOffice |- | Email & PIM | style="background-color:#fab372;" | Thunderbird | style="background-color:#87CEEB;" | Kontact |}
Kubuntu's Plasma Desktop is fully customizable, much more so than a GNOME or Unity desktop is without extra tools or configuration file editing. Originally designed to ease transition for users from other operating systems (such as Microsoft Windows) by allowing a similar desktop layout, the KDE Plasma Desktop incorporates widget-centric modularity that allows the user to incorporate function similar to all other operating systems and also create new functionality not found in other operating system desktops. Desktop effects are integrated in the standard [[KDE Software Compilation 4|KDE SC 4]] installation, and enabled by default if supported.
It is worth noting that because Ubuntu and Kubuntu use the same sources/origins for their software, any application intended for one is installable, and will work, on the other. This makes it very common to see Firefox on Kubuntu or K3B on Ubuntu.
== Gallery == <gallery perrow="3" widths="170px" heights="120px" style="font-size:90%; margin-right:1.5em"> File:Kubuntu.8.04.KDE.png|Kubuntu 8.04 File:Kubuntu GNU-Linux 8.10.png|Kubuntu 8.10 File:Kubuntu904.PNG|Kubuntu 9.04 File:Kubuntu-9.04-DesktopEffects.png|Kubuntu 9.04 showing some of its Desktop Effects File:Kubuntu-10.04 netbook.png|Kubuntu 10.04 Netbook Edition File:kubuntu1010.png|Kubuntu 10.10 Desktop </gallery>
==History== [[Mark Shuttleworth]], in an interview shortly after Ubuntu (which uses the [[Unity (user interface)|Unity desktop environment]]) was started, stated:
{{Quote|text=I believe that the KDE community does phenomenal work, and having a community-driven distribution to showcase that work will help attract users and developers to the project. Our overall goal in the Ubuntu project is to further the adoption of free software on the desktop and the server, and we recognise that KDE is an essential part of the mix of desktop environments that allows people to find the best environment for their needs.|[[Mark Shuttleworth]]|source=[http://lwn.net/Articles/181465/]}}
The Kubuntu team released the first edition, Hoary Hedgehog, on April 8, 2005.
==Releases== {| class="wikitable" style="width:24%;font-size:85%;float:right; margin-right:1.5em" |- ! Colour ! Meaning |- | style="background-color:#FA8072;" | Red | Release no longer supported |- | style="background-color:#f0e68c;" | Yellow | Release still supported |- | style="background-color:#A0E75A;" | Green | Current release |- | style="background-color:#87CEEB;" | Blue | Future release |}
Kubuntu follows the same naming/versioning system as Ubuntu, with each release having a code name and a version number (based on the year and month of release). Canonical provides support and security updates for most Kubuntu versions for 18 months after release.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/releases/ |title=Ubuntu Releases FAQ | accessdate=2006-12-21}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}}</ref> Both a [[Live CD|Desktop]] version and an Alternative (installation) version (for both x86 and AMD64 platforms) are available. Kubuntu CDs were also available through the [https://shipit.kubuntu.org/ Shipit] service(discontinued as of April 2011). Recent Kubuntu releases use [[KDE SC 4]]. An older KDE 3.5 edition, (as used in the Long Term Support version Hardy Heron) is also available (although currently unsupported).

== System requirements == The desktop version of Kubuntu currently supports the [[Intel x86]] and the [[AMD64]] architectures. Some releases additionally support the [[SPARC]] architecture.,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://cdimage.ubuntu.com/kubuntu/ports/releases/8.04.1/release/ |title=Kubuntu 8.04 Releases |accessdate=2009-03-11}}</ref> the [[PowerPC]],<ref>{{cite web |url=https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/ubuntu-announce/2007-February/000098.html |title=Technical Board Decision â February 2007 |accessdate=2008-06-13}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=http://cdimage.ubuntu.com/kubuntu/ports/releases/8.04.1/release/ | title=Kubuntu 8.04 Releases | accessdate=2009-03-11}}</ref> [[IA-64]] ([[Itanium]]), and [[PlayStation 3]] architectures (though, due to an official firmware update from [[Sony]] released in April 2010, users of the PS3 cannot run other operating systems on their machine â a feature previously supported by [[OtherOS]]). Because Kubuntu is Ubuntu with a KDE desktop, any version available in Ubuntu is also available for Kubuntu.
The minimum system requirements for a desktop installation are a 300 [[Hertz|MHz]] x86 processor, 512 [[megabyte|MB]] of RAM, 5 [[gigabyte|GB]] of hard drive space,<ref name="SystemRequirements">{{cite web |url=https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Installation/SystemRequirements |title=Ubuntu System Requirements |accessdate=2010-09-30}}</ref> and a video card which supports [[Video Graphics Array|VGA]] at 640x480 resolution. The recommended system requirements for the desktop installation are a 1 GHz or better x86 processor, 1 GB of RAM, 15 GB of hard drive space,<ref name="HDD install size">{{cite web |url=http://www.ubuntu.com/products/whatisubuntu/desktopedition |title=Ubuntu Desktop Edition |accessdate=2008-06-13}}</ref> and a video card which supports VGA at 1024Ã768 resolution, and optionally supporting visual effects.
{| class="wikitable" cellpadding="3" cellspacing="0" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2" | ! colspan="2" |[[Desktop computer|Desktop]] & [[laptop]]<ref name="SystemRequirements">{{cite web|url=https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Installation/SystemRequirements|title=Ubuntu System Requirements|accessdate=2008-09-303}}</ref> |- ! Required ! Recommended |- ![[Central processing unit|Processor]] | 1 GHz (x86) | Better than 1 GHz (x86) |- ![[RAM|Memory]] | 384 MB | 1 GB |- ![[Hard disk drive|Hard drive]] capacity | 4 GB<ref name="HDD install size" /> | 10 GB<ref name="HDD install size" /> |- ![[Video card]] | VGA @ 640x480 | VGA @ 1024x768 |}
<nowiki>*</nowiki>Note: If "[[Kwin#Compositing|Desktop effects]]" are desired, a supported [[Graphics processing unit|GPU]] is required.
== Quality == {{Weasel|section|date=August 2011}} Before Kubuntu 10.10, there was some aggravation by members of the community and general reputation online was a commonly negative one.{{cn|date=October 2011}}
Causes: * '''Lack of branding''' â since the transition to KDE SC4{{cn|date=October 2011}} * '''Delay of Ubuntu improvements into Kubuntu''' â sometimes requiring a release or two{{cn|date=October 2011}} * '''Stability of software'''{{cn|date=October 2011}}
Responses: * '''Project Timelord'''<ref>[http://www.kubuntu.org/news/timelord "Project Timelord Announcement"]</ref> â An initiative, name inspired by [[Doctor Who]], to improve the developer workflow and quality of Kubuntu. * '''Working Upstream''' â Much of the work done by Kubuntu developers is done in upstream, such as furthering [[Get Hot New Stuff|GHNS]] integration and the KDE SC 4.4 login manager theme.<ref>[http://jontheechidna.wordpress.com/2010/05/04/a-review-gone-wrong/ "A review gone wrong"] A Kubuntu developer dissects a negative review.</ref> * '''Best in class (KDE)''' â The use of Ubuntu's PPA system allows easy upgrading to the latest KDE SC. The argument is that if the user wants the latest KDE software, he/she runs Kubuntu.
Many pieces from the KDE community have matured and stabilized.{{cn|date=October 2011}} Kubuntu's package manager has a category view very similar to that of the Ubuntu software center, the default web browser is now based on webkit, and many more features showcased in Ubuntu are being matched by those in Kubuntu, such as the upcoming wireless connection page in the installer discs.
== Reception == The French Parliament announced in 2006 that they would switch over 1,000 workstations to Kubuntu by June 2007.<ref>[http://fridge.ubuntu.com/node/814 "The French Parliament switches to Kubuntu"]</ref><ref>[http://news.zdnet.com/2100-3513_22-150389.html "French parliament dumping Windows for Linux"]</ref>
Kubuntu is now used in all of the 1100 state-run schools in the [[Canary Islands]].<ref>[http://news.softpedia.com/news/Kubuntu-in-the-Canary-Islands-67182.shtml "Kubuntu in the Canary Islands"]</ref><ref>[http://fridge.ubuntu.com/2007/09/28/kubuntu-takes-over-the-canary-islands/ "Kubuntu Takes Over the Canary Islands"]</ref>
The [[Weta Digital]] rendering cluster of 35,000 machines are computers running Kubuntu as their desktop.<ref>[http://www.kdedevelopers.org/node/4203 "Cool Kubuntu Users"]</ref>
